title: Real Estate Bubble Map:  Boston
name: Real Estate Bubble Map:  Boston
description:
A Map by Realestatecafe

Single-family homes sold recently in Greater Boston for below their assessed value or well below their original asking price.  You can access nationwide maps of overvalued housing markets and past housing price corrections by clicking on any &quot;RealEstateCafe&quot; link above, or cutting and pasting these links:

71 &quot;Extremely overvalued&quot; housing markets:
http://www.platial.com/realestatecafe/map/7060 

66 Past housing price corrections
http://www.platial.com/realestatecafe/map/7317

Your comments and contributions are welcome, particularly if you are a househunter, bubble blogger, or a fellow buyer agent (no dual agents need apply).  If you start your own Platial map, please send us a message so we can link to each other and share content.

If you become a client, we'd be glad to share our commission, too.  Visit http://http://realestatecafe.com/commission_rebates_menu.html for details on rebate options or email RECafe@mac.com.  You can also earn commission credits for comments, photos, video, or audio clips you add to the Boston bubble map.  See our &quot;Tipping Policy&quot; for details:

http://realestatebubblemap.pbwiki.com/Tipping%20policy

If you are househunting outside Boston, we'd be delighted to refer you to an exclusive buyer agent -- perhaps one contributing to our national maps -- and rebate one-third of our referral fee (where allowed by law), and donate another third to the proposed Million Dollar March to help save lives or provide shelter subsidies for AIDS orphans.  For more information, see:

http://tinyurl.com/kl5nc

properties.name: 25 Maple Ave, Cambridge, MA
properties.description: Posted by Westsidebubble25 Maple Ave, Cambridge, MAPrice 95,000 Sold Price 20,500 Sold Date 06/23/2006 Days on Market 101 days Assessed Value: 51,100 Previous Assessed Value: 87,000 Sale History 06/12/2003: 99,000 11/30/2000: 95,000 The seller actually lost money on the deal from 2003 - 2006 if you include realtor fee and factor in inflation, and list price was below assessed value. This is a strange one, though. Final sale was 5K over asking after 101 DOM? I don\'t get it. It was listed for less than the previous sale, which should give you an indication of what the market is like in Cambridge.

properties.name: Arlington : 39 Lorraine Ter
properties.description: Posted by Vuky39 Lorraine Ter, Arlington, MA 02474Original asking price: 30,000 Sales price: 35,000 (masslandrecords.com) Closing date: August 2006 Days on market: 120+ Percent saved: 19% Dollars saved: 5,000 A house in a great shape. Lost of granite however bedrooms are small. Interesting tidbit is that sellers priced it well above the appraisal ie. I saw appraisal sellers provided from 03/2006 which recommended prices IIRC 490-510k so I was surprised to see they priced it above that.

properties.name: Boston:  167 Commonwealth Ave, Unit 3
properties.description: Posted by Realestatecafe167 Commonwealth Ave, Unit 3, Boston MA 02116Our first example of how the nationwide credit crunch is hitting Boston, MA. Originally listed at 95,000 on 3/22/07, this MLS property has been under agreement three times over the past five months: 1. Underagreement on 5/22 and back on the market on 5/23/07; 2. Underagreement on 6/21 after a 00,000 price reduction then back on the market on 7/6/07. 3. Although it never appeared as "underagreement" last week, the most recent offer fell through last week, approximately 8/16/07. By failing to record listings as being "under agreement" in a timely manner, listing agencies may be masking the magnitude of the unfolding credit crunch. ----- You can help other home buyers assess the magnitude of the credit crunch by adding listings that are "back on market" to The Real Estate Cafe\'s bubble map, oradd your prediction: How far will rising cost of jumbo loans drive prices down?

properties.name: Westford: 54 Nutting Rd
properties.description: Posted by Nookala 54 Nutting Road, Westford MAAssessed value: 80,200 Sales price: 57,000 Saved vs assessment: 3,200 This was a beautiful house with lots of space and a great and spacious backyard abutting conservation land. The sale price of this near perfect home so far below assesed value is a very visible sign of the market slowdown, especially obvious in westford with tons of homes for sale. The agent at one of Open Houses I had gone to in Westford mentioned that only 5-10 houses had closed in the busy summer season in the town, the house he was selling was promptly marked down from 64,000 to 29,000 the week after the Open House.
